shows.name: Rants Off/ Dance Off
shows.bio:
Rants Off / Dance Off is a comedy game show where comedians compete in a battle of vulnerabilities both verbal and physical! Contestants offer their heated opinions on subjects--some prepared, some improvised--and then, like ice cream to a hot pepper so foolishly eaten whole, sooth their raw nerves by dancing their hearts out. Judgement is summarily doled out panel-style. Winners receive little but pride and regrets. Great fun is had by all!

Rants Off / Dance Off has been a part of Bridgetown, All Jane Comedy Festival, and Bumbershoot. Hosted by Whitney Streed with musical direction by Manuel Hall.
shows.copy: Rants Off / Dance Off has been a part of Bridgetown, All Jane Comedy Festival, and Bumbershoot. Hosted by Whitney Streed with musical direction by Manuel Hall.

shows.name: Gay Bash
shows.copy: Join Guy Branum as he puts his gayest foot forward to bring you his favourite cavalcade of merry men and women.

shows.name: Reunited!
shows.bio:
Reunited! brings together the casts of beloved sitcoms for in-depth panel discussions, Q & A sessions, and table-reads of classic scenes.

 

The catch? The shows never existed, except in the minds of hosts/show-creators Josh Androsky and Bryan Cook.  Additionally, none of the guests have any prior knowledge of the series they “starred” on.

 

Cook and Androsky create a fictionalized world where a panel of comics discuss personal issues, professional pitfalls, and brushes with the law. It would be the most scandalous show in Hollywood if any of it had ever happened.
shows.copy: The show debuted to a sold-out crowd at the Hollywood Improv Lab in February of 2016. Bryan Cook and Josh Androsky are well-known Los Angeles comics, writers, and live show producers. Cook founded and hosts Competitive Erotic Fan Fiction, as well as weekly standup showcase ‘Big Money Comedy,’ at The Virgil in Los Angeles. He has written for JASH, Funny or Die, and Triumph the Insult Comic Dog. Androsky co-hosts weekly standup showcase ‘Babe Island,’ has appeared on ‘This American Life,’ and written for Billy on the Street and Spongebob Squarepants.

shows.name: Crabapples
shows.bio:
Comedy Legend Bobcat Goldthwait and Caitlin Gill (Take My Wife writer, also Bobcat's roommate) gather some of the most eclectic personalities around, and bring together a comedy/variety show that celebrates everyone's own wierdness and individuality. Its common to find Drag Queens, Standups, Poets, and modern dancers all on one show, while tieing together a common theme. 

Named one of the best local shows in Los Angeles by LA WEEKLY, Crabapples has sold out at SF Sketchfest and RIOT LA Fest this year, and will be touring this year!
shows.copy:
Bobcat Goldthwait and Caitlin Gill are friends. They have other friends too. Friends who are top notch comedians. Come see friends with their friends being friends! FRIENDS!

Crabapples brings together the comedians that Bobcat and Caitlin admire and love to watch. Because Blobcat and Caitfin came up in different eras and in different scenes, the show is full of comics you've known and loved for years, and the comics you will learn about and love for years to come. Bloatcarb and Cakebinge invite you to join the party every week, but especially THIS SHOW
